intro: Papaver argemone var. pauciseta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved poppy, is a variant of the argemone poppy native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its flowers consist of four petals and are surrounded by a prominent, saucer-shaped calyx. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
